rule.name: js/cross-window-information-leak
rule.short_description: Cross-window communication with unrestricted target origin
rule.full_description: When sending sensitive information to another window using `postMessage`, the origin of the target window should be restricted to avoid unintentional information leaks.

issues.message: This regular expression only parses --> and not --!> as a HTML comment end tag.

rule.name: js/bad-tag-filter
rule.full_description: Matching HTML tags using regular expressions is hard to do right, and can easily lead to security issues.

issues.message: This self-closing HTML tag expansion invalidates prior sanitization as [this regular expression](1) may match part of an attribute value.

rule.name: js/unsafe-html-expansion
rule.short_description: Unsafe expansion of self-closing HTML tag
rule.full_description: Using regular expressions to expand self-closing HTML tags may lead to cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

rule.name: js/incomplete-html-attribute-sanitization
rule.full_description: Writing incompletely sanitized values to HTML attribute strings can lead to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

issues.message: This assignment may alter Object.prototype if a malicious '__proto__' string is injected from [library input](1).

rule.name: js/prototype-polluting-assignment
rule.full_description: Modifying an object obtained via a user-controlled property name may lead to accidental mutation of the built-in Object prototype, and possibly escalate to remote code execution or cross-site scripting.
